|rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = none |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Additional specifications, per '''CLEAR''', follow... *SKU / P/N: IFM-910CW *Dimensions: 2.6" (D) x 2.6" (W) x 0.5" (H) *Weight: 2.1 oz *Battery: 1500mAh (up to 6 hours continuous run time) *Range: 100 ft Per the manual, you can reset the device to factory defaults by... *Turn on the device, holding the power button down for 3-4 seconds *Release the power button when the Power LED turns red *When the device is powered on, press and hold the power button for 10 seconds *Release the power button when the 4G LED turns amber. The device will then automatically turn off and has then been reset.. The SSID format used by the devices is '''ClearSPOT_XXXXX''', where '''XXXXX''' is the last 5 digits of the WLAN MAC (lower case letters). ==Links of Interest== [http://www.clear.com/support/download/spots/clear-spot-voyager Downloads] "[http://registry.wimaxforum.org/certification/403 BISCUIT_MINI] 2.3G/2.5G REV1.1" and "2011.07.23" appears to be silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
"BISCUIT_MINI 2.3G/2.5G REV 1.2A" and "2011.10.11" would seem to be silkscreened on some (most? all?) production model boards. :The FCC EUT's battery is marked with "OCEANSUN 554855P 5.92Wh". [http://www.olilio.com/file/detail/BBCV2.MH45908.html This Li-ion battery would appear to be manufactured by '''Shenzhen OceanSun Battery Co., Ltd.''']. [[Category:English Documentation]]
